title: singleEnd = FALSE for ChIPseqSpikeInFree wrapper script
body:
Hi,

I was wondering if you could help me clarify the processing of paired end data. 
I've noticed that while you can set singleEnd =FALSE argument for the CountRawReads() function, it is not possible with the wrapper function, which then by default treats the data as single end.

I did try to run functions on their own, but it then stops at the parsing step giving the error:
ooops: you need to change metadata file **\n

Thank you for your help!

Monica

title: Endpoints for slope calculation?
body: Hi! I'm just starting to use this tool and was wondering - how are the X and Y coordinates of the two points used for slope calculation determined? I tried running the program twice, first on a given set of samples, and next on a smaller subset of the first set, and got noticeably different X/Y coordinates and scaling factors for the same samples, which was confusing to me.

title: Normalization factor vs. scale factor
body:
Hello, 

The SF in the output file (test_SF.txt) is scale factor and DGEList function in edgeR needs normalization factors. So I think the 
norm.factors should be 1/SF.

> dge <- DGEList(counts = counts, group = GROUP, norm.factors = SF)

should be:

> dge <- DGEList(counts = counts, group = GROUP, norm.factors = 1/SF)

And in the part: What happens if 100% complete loss is expected? You just used 1/SF. This is a little confusing. 

Would you please clarify this issue?

Thanks

title: normalized bigwigs
body:
Hi,
thank you for the useful tool! I just have one question on this part:
**3.pseudo-code for generation of bigwig files from a bed file
libSize=`cat sample1.bed|wc -l`
scale=15000000/($libSize*$SF)
genomeCoverageBed -bg -scale $scale -i sample1.bed  -g mm9.chromSizes > sample1.bedGraph
bedGraphToBigWig sample1.bedGraph mm9.chromSizes sample1.bw**
 
I am not sure about the origin of this parameter 15000000. I would appreciate if you could explain why it was chosen.

Thank you!

title: using for normalization
body:
Hi.
If I have an experiment with two different antibodies, one (anti-A) showing a lower signal in western blot, and the other (anti-B) not showing much change, could I use ChIPseqSpikeInFree for data collected from both antibodies, or should I only use it for anti-A? Both antibodies target H3.

Thank you for your help.
